title: FRITTE / FRITTE CLERK
description: A dialogue with a bored teenage girl who works as a shop clerk.

dialogueTree.title: Frittte clerk: ""Um, is this about the questions ag..."
dialogueTree.text: "Um, is this about the questions again? 'Cause I don't really know anything..." She puts down the magazine.

links.title: You: ""What kind of discounts can a man w..."
links.text: "What kind of discounts can a man with net worth get in here?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm..." She looks up from her maga..."
links.text: "Uhm..." She looks up from her magazine, not really sure how to reply.

links.title: Rhetoric: "That's teen-speak for 'no' -- *no d..."
links.text: That's teen-speak for 'no' -- *no discounts*.

links.title: Composure: "She couldn't be more unbothered by..."
links.text: She couldn't be more unbothered by your question if she tried.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excuse us -- my partner here of co..."
links.text: "Excuse us -- my partner here of course knows that net worth is not *legal tender*." The lieutenant gives you a quick glance.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, I don't know..." She returns..."
links.text: "Yeah, I don't know..." She returns to her magazine.

links.title: You: ""I need to exchange this novelty ch..."
links.text: "I need to exchange this novelty cheque for cash." (Give her the novelty cheque and gain 25 re√°l.)

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uh, wow, I didn't know you worked..."
links.text: "Uh, wow, I didn't know you worked for the Union, sir." She rolls up the giant novelty cheque -- looks like she's seen it before -- and slips it under the counter.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Anything else I can do for you?""
links.text: "Anything else I can do for you?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "No, you don't work for the Union, t..."
links.text: No, you don't work for the Union, the Union works for you -- by supplying you with *cash*.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That was easy! Worryingly so..."
links.text: That was easy! Worryingly so...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Blow the whole thing on speed and g..."
links.text: Blow the whole thing on speed and gin, right now. Speed -- AND GIN. Great combo. Ask some local dealers maybe...

links.title: You: ""Does Frittte have a warehouse in t..."
links.text: "Does Frittte have a warehouse in the back of the Whirling-in-Rags?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""A warehouse? I don't know. Maybe...."
links.text: "A warehouse? I don't know. Maybe. I don't really care what Frittte does."

links.title: You: ""Come on, give me something to work..."
links.text: "Come on, give me something to work with here."

links.title: Frittte clerk: "She looks up from under her brow."
links.text: She looks up from under her brow.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Fine -- Frittte doesn't have a war..."
links.text: "Fine -- Frittte doesn't have a warehouse. Just a little back room here. M'kay?" She turns back to her magazine without waiting for you to respond.

links.title: You: ""This is *important*.""
links.text: "This is *important*."

links.title: Frittte clerk: "She scrunches up her face into an e..."
links.text: She scrunches up her face into an expression of consummate adolescent scepticism.

links.title: You: ""Do you have a fridge?""
links.text: "Do you have a fridge?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Mhmh, right behind you." She nods..."
links.text: "Mhmh, right behind you." She nods towards the buzzing machine in the corner.

links.title: You: ""You're right, this *is* a fridge!..."
links.text: "You're right, this *is* a fridge! Wicked."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah..." She's not really paying a..."
links.text: "Yeah..." She's not really paying attention to you anymore.

links.title: You: ""Well, enough about the fridge then.""
links.text: "Well, enough about the fridge then."

links.title: Frittte clerk: "She's playing with her hair, engros..."
links.text: She's playing with her hair, engrossed in a magazine.

links.title: You: ""I need to store a corpse there.""
links.text: "I need to store a corpse there."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm..." She keeps chewing on her g..."
links.text: "Uhm..." She keeps chewing on her gum. "You're joking, right?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, this was just a joke." (Cough..."
links.text: "Yes, this was just a joke." (Cough.) "A bad joke."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, super funny." She returns to..."
links.text: "Yeah, super funny." She returns to her magazine, seemingly not impressed by the joke.

links.title: You: "(Measure the fridge with your finge..."
links.text: (Measure the fridge with your fingers, one eye closed.) "Never mind... It would never fit."

links.title: You: ""No, I'm not joking. I need to stor..."
links.text: "No, I'm not joking. I need to store the corpse of the hanged man in your fridge."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, okay..." she looks at the fri..."
links.text: "Uhm, okay..." she looks at the fridge. "It wouldn't even fit you know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now that I'm looking at it... mayb..."
links.text: "Now that I'm looking at it... maybe a glass-doored fridge in a public grocery store isn't the best option for storing a corpse."

links.title: You: ""Pity. It would've been so beautifu..."
links.text: "Pity. It would've been so beautiful."

links.title: You: ""I guess you're right, plus the fri..."
links.text: "I guess you're right, plus the fridge is too small anyway."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""M'kay..." She returns to her magaz..."
links.text: "M'kay..." She returns to her magazine.

links.title: You: ""Well, thanks, Frittte clerk.""
links.text: "Well, thanks, Frittte clerk."

links.title: Logic: "Maybe a glass-doored fridge in a pu..."
links.text: Maybe a glass-doored fridge in a public grocery store really isn't the best option for storing a corpse.

links.title: You: ""Do you have any ammonia for sale?""
links.text: "Do you have any ammonia for sale?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: "She looks up from her magazine, eye..."
links.text: She looks up from her magazine, eyes filled with tired ennui.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yes." She hitches her thumb toward..."
links.text: "Yes." She hitches her thumb toward the end of the counter. "What we have is there, in the medicine cabinet -- go take a look yourself..."

links.title: You: ""You said I wouldn't want to 'fuck..."
links.text: "You said I wouldn't want to 'fuck with Frittte'. Why?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Because Frittte has an army?""
links.text: "Because Frittte has an army?"

links.title: Composure: "She blinks at you, confused as to w..."
links.text: She blinks at you, confused as to why you'd ask such an obvious thing.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, so it's true? Frittte has..."
links.text: "Hold on, so it's true? Frittte has actual *mercenaries*, ready to *kill people*?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, like two thousand or so." Sh..."
links.text: "Yeah, like two thousand or so." She says it as if it's completely natural.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, an army? You mean like......"
links.text: "Hold on, an army? You mean like... *mercenaries*? Ready to *kill people*?"

links.title: You: ""But why would Frittte need an army..."
links.text: "But why would Frittte need an army? It's just a corner shop."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I dunno." She shrugs. "It stops pe..."
links.text: "I dunno." She shrugs. "It stops people from robbing Frittte, I guess? If they know there's an army, I mean... I wouldn't want to fuck with them, anyway."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Businesses often hire private secu..."
links.text: "Businesses often hire private security this side of the river. It's an unfortunate state of affairs, but not unheard of."

links.title: You: ""But that's what the cops are for...""
links.text: "But that's what the cops are for..."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""You think the police, like... both..."
links.text: "You think the police, like... bother catching shoplifters?" She rolls her eyes. "Frittte polices themselves, so... Yeah. Anything else you wanted?"

links.title: Half Light: "You better behave yourself in this..."
links.text: You better behave yourself in this Frittte. Or who knows what will happen.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, good point... Actually, I ha..."
links.text: "Yeah, good point... Actually, I had other questions as well."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""M'kay." She's chewing on her bubbl..."
links.text: "M'kay." She's chewing on her bubblegum again. "What do you want to know?"

links.title: You: ""Can you tell me anything about the..."
links.text: "Can you tell me anything about the dead body?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, I don't really know anything?..."
links.text: "Uhm, I don't really know anything? I mean, I know it's there? But I haven't seen it, so..."

links.title: You: ""Did you know the man who died?""
links.text: "Did you know the man who died?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Not really?""
links.text: "Not really?"

links.title: You: ""Not really? Does it mean you knew..."
links.text: "Not really? Does it mean you knew him *a little*?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, no. I didn't know him at all.""
links.text: "Uhm, no. I didn't know him at all."

links.title: You: ""How long has it been there?""
links.text: "How long has it been there?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I don't know. Really *long*?""
links.text: "I don't know. Really *long*?"

links.title: You: ""What do you think happened?""
links.text: "What do you think happened?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm... I don't know?""
links.text: "Uhm... I don't know?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need to worry." The lieutenant'..."
links.text: "No need to worry." The lieutenant's voice is soothing and professional. "It's just standard procedure for us to ask around. If you hear anything, let us know. Okay?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""M'kay." She scratches her nose."
links.text: "M'kay." She scratches her nose.

links.title: You: ""Thank your for your help.""
links.text: "Thank your for your help."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uh-uh." She brushes a strand of ha..."
links.text: "Uh-uh." She brushes a strand of hair off her face and tries to return to her magazine.

links.title: You: ""Can you tell me anything about thi..."
links.text: "Can you tell me anything about this reality we're in?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Reality? You mean... what reality?..."
links.text: "Reality? You mean... what reality? Economic reality? Or..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "She is like a student unexpectedly..."
links.text: She is like a student unexpectedly called upon by a teacher. Can she answer the classroom question?

links.title: You: ""Yes, tell me about the economic re..."
links.text: "Yes, tell me about the economic reality."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I don't really know anything? I me..."
links.text: "I don't really know anything? I mean, I'm fifteen."

links.title: You: ""Fifteen is an *excellent* time to..."
links.text: "Fifteen is an *excellent* time to learn about the economic reality."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah." She looks at the clock on t..."
links.text: "Yeah." She looks at the clock on the wall. "That's why I'm working my ass off in Frittte. So I guess, like, that's economic."

links.title: You: ""What about the physical reality th..."
links.text: "What about the physical reality then?"

links.title: You: ""No, I meant the physical reality.""
links.text: "No, I meant the physical reality."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I don't know. What about it?""
links.text: "I don't know. What about it?"

links.title: You: ""Where are we?""
links.text: "Where are we?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""We're in Frittte?""
links.text: "We're in Frittte?"

links.title: You: ""No, I meant -- where *are* we, on..."
links.text: "No, I meant -- where *are* we, on a larger scale?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""As mankind or... as a nation or...""
links.text: "As mankind or... as a nation or..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "What will her essay prompt be?"
links.text: What will her essay prompt be?

links.title: You: ""As a mankind.""
links.text: "As a mankind."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""In a good place?"  She rubs her fa..."
links.text: "In a good place?"  She rubs her face, thinking.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I mean, science is doing great......"
links.text: "I mean, science is doing great... and this radiocomputer thing seems to be kinda big? I don't know." She shrugs, then folds her magazine back.

links.title: You: ""As a nation.""
links.text: "As a nation."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, we're in a.... we're in a..."..."
links.text: "Uhm, we're in a.... we're in a..." She rubs her face, thinking.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""We're in a *transition*! You know,..."
links.text: "We're in a *transition*! You know, transitioning from, uh... monarchy to democracy, all that stuff." She nods, then folds her magazine back.

links.title: You: ""Like... where in the world?""
links.text: "Like... where in the world?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""We're in Revachol? Like, on the In..."
links.text: "We're in Revachol? Like, on the Insulindian isola?"

links.title: You: ""Thank you.""
links.text: "Thank you."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""You're welcome?" She folds her mag..."
links.text: "You're welcome?" She folds her magazine back.

links.title: You: ""I was just testing your knowledge.""
links.text: "I was just testing your knowledge."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""That wasn't very hard." She folds..."
links.text: "That wasn't very hard." She folds her magazine back.

links.title: You: ""You know what? Never mind.""
links.text: "You know what? Never mind."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""M'kay. I won't." She folds her mag..."
links.text: "M'kay. I won't." She folds her magazine back and starts to read.

links.title: You: ""What time is it?""
links.text: "What time is it?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I don't know, look at the clock. I..."
links.text: "I don't know, look at the clock. It's right behind you on the wall."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The clock shows the time at 10:09...."
links.text: The clock shows the time at 10:09. The hands seem to be still. It's apparent the clock doesn't work.

links.title: You: ""What is the Revolution?""
links.text: "What is the Revolution?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""When ordinary people take over the..."
links.text: "When ordinary people take over the government and, uhm... demand democracy?"

links.title: You: ""What about the one we had here in..."
links.text: "What about the one we had here in Revachol?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, it happened like 50 years ag..."
links.text: "Yeah, it happened like 50 years ago or so. Sorry, I'm not very good at this. At history, I mean."

links.title: You: ""The Coalition -- what's that? Some..."
links.text: "The Coalition -- what's that? Someone told me there is one."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Our government?""
links.text: "Our government?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Or do you mean something else...?..."
links.text: "Or do you mean something else...? Sorry, I really need to finish this article." She taps the magazine on the counter.

links.title: You: ""What is pale?""
links.text: "What is pale?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I think science still doesn't know..."
links.text: "I think science still doesn't know? There's only speculation."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Though some of my friends from sch..."
links.text: "Though some of my friends from school have actually *travelled* through pale on their trip to Mundi. They said it was like being high." She smiles widely, then catches herself.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Not that they would know anything..."
links.text: "Not that they would know anything about being high, it's just an expression." The girl adjusts her hat.

links.title: You: ""I won't bother you with this non-s..."
links.text: "I won't bother you with this non-sense anymore."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Cool." She seems happy to return t..."
links.text: "Cool." She seems happy to return to her reading.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Frittte clerk: ""Welcome to Frittte! Feel free to l..."
dialogueTree.text: "Welcome to Frittte! Feel free to look around or something, everything is out on the shelves." She returns to her magazine.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What's that magazine she's reading?"
links.text: What's that magazine she's reading?

links.title: You: ""Before we go on, what is this Frit..."
links.text: "Before we go on, what is this Frittte?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I don't know -- Frittte?" She shru..."
links.text: "I don't know -- Frittte?" She shrugs.

links.title: You: ""And what *is* Frittte?""
links.text: "And what *is* Frittte?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""A 7-to-11 grocery store?""
links.text: "A 7-to-11 grocery store?"

links.title: You: ""Why is it written with three T-s?""
links.text: "Why is it written with three T-s?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""I think they think that extra T ma..."
links.text: "I think they think that extra T makes it *funkier*..." She chews on her gum with disgust. "It doesn't."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The story goes that normal Fritte w..."
links.text: The story goes that normal Fritte with two T-s (a men's workwear shop in Vredefort) was already taken, so when Fritte Retail, Inc. grew into a multinational corporation they had to add an extra letter to avoid trademark infringement.

links.title: You: ""What magazine are you reading?""
links.text: "What magazine are you reading?"

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""You mean this?" She looks at the c..."
links.text: "You mean this?" She looks at the cover boasting a colourful photo of two girls kissing.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""This is Pop-Stars, it's got, like,..."
links.text: "This is Pop-Stars, it's got, like, famous people in it? It's not for sale."

links.title: Composure: "Looks like it also has something ca..."
links.text: Looks like it also has something called 'Police De La Mode' featured on page 34. This speaks to you.

links.title: You: ""Stupid famous people.""
links.text: "Stupid famous people."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, they're kind of boring, but,..."
links.text: "Yeah, they're kind of boring, but, you know..." She never finishes the sentence.

links.title: You: ""I approve of this, very futuristic..."
links.text: "I approve of this, very futuristic." (Tap on the girls kissing.)

links.title: Frittte clerk: "She pops her raspberry-flavoured bu..."
links.text: She pops her raspberry-flavoured bubblegum and nods.

links.title: Composure: "Her shoulders tense. She shuffles b..."
links.text: Her shoulders tense. She shuffles back only slightly; bewilderment and repulsion root her in place.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant frowns at you, befor..."
links.text: The lieutenant frowns at you, before turning to the clerk with an apologetic half-smile.

links.title: You: ""Forget about all that -- what this..."
links.text: "Forget about all that -- what this is *fashion police* feature?" (Point at the cover.)

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, it's where they rate differen..."
links.text: "Uhm, it's where they rate different outfits famous people wear? It's kinda funny. They're kinda mean." She stops to think. "It's about who's the most stylish."

links.title: You: ""Who's the numero uno guy in there..."
links.text: "Who's the numero uno guy in there right now -- and does he look like *this*?" (Point at yourself.)

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm..." Her lazy eyes scan up and..."
links.text: "Uhm..." Her lazy eyes scan up and down your body, assessing the situation.

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""No, I don't think so.""
links.text: "No, I don't think so."

links.title: You: "(Point to her hat.) "I bet your hat..."
links.text: (Point to her hat.) "I bet your hat would take the prize."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Uhm, no. I don't like it, I hate i..."
links.text: "Uhm, no. I don't like it, I hate it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We are not the fashion police." Th..."
links.text: "We are not the fashion police." The lieutenant looks at you. "We're the real police."

links.title: You: ""So who is the most stylish there?..."
links.text: "So who is the most stylish there? It can't be anyone from here."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Benita. She's a model. Usually it'..."
links.text: "Benita. She's a model. Usually it's a model. Or a singer-songwriter. Or a model."

links.title: You: ""I'm not even interested in that ma..."
links.text: "I'm not even interested in that magazine. I don't know why I asked about it."

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Yeah, me neither.""
links.text: "Yeah, me neither."

links.title: You: ""Let's proceed, I have some questio..."
links.text: "Let's proceed, I have some questions for you." (Continue.)

links.title: Frittte clerk: ""Um, okay. I'm not really supposed..."
links.text: "Um, okay. I'm not really supposed to be chatting to anyone, but..." She puts down the magazine.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
